snippet: In the early 1980s, receiving a bachelor of arts degree in just about any subject “opened up lots of jobs,” experts say. Oh, how times have changed.
abstract: Alina Tugend Shortcuts column documents the historical emergence of college majors as a determinant of job opportunities and income; notes that before the early 1980s, a bachelor of arts degree in nearly any subject could lead to opportunities in diverse and unrelated fields.
lead_paragraph: In the early 1980s, receiving a bachelor of arts degree in just about any subject “opened up lots of jobs,” experts say. Oh, how times have changed.

headline.seo: Career or Deep Learning? Pondering the Purpose of College
headline.main: Vocation or Exploration? Pondering the Purpose of College
headline.print_headline: Vocation or Exploration? Pondering the Purpose of College
